result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler G. Bostrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tyler G. Bostrom is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tyler G. Bostrom was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler G. Bostrom

Per DOC Agt Jenny Merlin the deft paid all outstanding court obligations in full and therefore the PRH of 12/16/16 at 11:15am is cancelled.
Probation review hearing on December 16, 2016 at 11:15 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
For Ct 2 only - Dismissed and read in.
For Ct 3 - Dismissed.
And order for other prosecution costs in the amount of:  $43.00
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney R DeFilippis.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 15 months w/conditions; DNA sample ordered; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge.

2:50 p.m. - Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Rocco DeFilippis.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Bench warrant vacated; signature bond reinstated.  Def. admits to the court that if he submitted to a UA today it would be positive for THC.  Plea hearing 10/15/15 at 8:15.  Bond continued.

10:20 a.m. - Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty Rocco DeFilippis appeared for def.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. did not appear.  Signature bond ordered forfeited.  Bench warrant to issue; bond set at $1,000.00 cash.  Jury selection on 10/26/15 is removed from the calendar.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty R DeFilippis appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty DeFilippis states the deft is at work out of State but the case is resolved; says he will be requesting to waive the PSI.  PLEAH set for 10/8/15 at 10am; if DOC prepares a memo the court will consider proceeding to sentencing on this date without a PSI.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney R DeFilippis.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case is not resolved.  JSH 9/29/15 at 1:15pm and JS 10/26/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney R DeFilippis.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty DeFilippis state the case is resolved but he needs to obtain a transcript from the sentencing hearing in 13CF864.  FPT continued to 8/21/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Rocco DeFilippis. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. DAPT on 6-19-15 @ 1:30pm. Judicial pretrial on 7-8-15 @ 8:30am.  Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing
atty: R Defilippis

1:18  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Rocco Defilippis. Clerk LE.   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 5-22-15 @ 9:00 am. Atty Defilippis moves to dismiss Ct 3. Court grants motion. Ct 3 dismiss without prejudice.  $1000.00 Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Weapons.  No drug par.
